fields.description:
Hi,

Trying to move my github repositories over to here and im getting a 500 internal error.

Thanks
fields.summary: 500 Internal Error when Importing from Github

fields.description:
Clicking "Next" on a commit page with a specific branch selected, it will forward users to a dead link:

!4271184378-deadlink.png|thumbnail!

Clicking "Next" on a commit page with "All branches" tab selected works just fine.

Workaround: the syntax "%3F" in the link should be a "?" instead

!2303433017-deadlink2.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Clicking "Next" on a commit page with a specific branch selected, it will forward users to a dead link. (BB-14991)

fields.description:
As far as I can tell: I can only see the branch name for branches that aren't ...'linked' I guess.

I have to make informed guesses that master is the deep blue/purple one and the pink one is develop.

!4028949182-Screen_Shot_2015-11-10_at_11_28_08.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: which branch on commits page (BB-15040)

fields.description:
# Create a snippet (Mercurial)
# Clone via HTTPS
# Notice a 404 not found error
fields.summary: Cloning a snippet via Mercurial HTTPS URL does not work (BB-14968)
Strange behaviour of Wiki (Creole)

fields.description:
I like the option to sync a repo with the repo it was forked from (GitHub doesn't have this I think!).  This always creates a merge commit, even when a fast-forward is possible.  I think it would be nice if it was possible to, optionally, do a fast-forward when that's possible (ie when the fork is properly behind the repo it was forked from).

This is not a big deal: it's easy enough to do this by pull/push to a local clone, but it would be nice to not have to do that.
fields.summary: Option to sync repos via fast-forward would be nice (BB-14970)

fields.description:
I create branches in Bitbucket from Jira Issues.\\
Bitbucket repos have WebHooks that report to Slack channels.

Branch creation gets notified in Slack as a "branch push".\\
And lists unnecessary commits (the previous "master" branch commits).

While it's probably understandable because of how GIT works, it's really not practical (misleading notifications on branch creation) and probably could be improved.
fields.summary: Jira/Bitbucket/Slack branch creation (BB-14971)

fields.description: Source Tree crashes when I tap remote repository button ,I have the latest version SourceTree 2.0.5.5 on  Mac.
fields.summary: Source Tree crashes when I tap remote repository button

fields.description:
I get this message when a try to confirm my new mail "We were unable to confirm the email address. The validation email may have expired"\\
Tried multiple times to resent confirmation it doesn't work
fields.summary: Can't confirm my new mail

fields.description:
Hi, I'm trying to fork the repo at https://bitbucket.org/snowcatsystems_odobo/free-games (I have read access) into odobo/odb_freegames.

The progress bar has been spinning for many minutes now, and yet a simple clone takes a few seconds.

Could you please have a look into what is going on?
fields.summary: Repository fork process hanging

fields.description:
Hello, i'm running into an issue about sending invitation too my friend.\\
He did receive the invitation and Bitbucket says the invitation request is no longer valid.\\
How can i proceed in this matter?

!2398398652-NWE@%7B$V99G7@B$002EUO%7B83.png|thumbnail!

Here is my friends email adress.\\
ryumin13@netmarble.com

How can I send the invitation again?
fields.summary: Friend invitation not sent

fields.description: Lines of codes amount to around 2500 lines and above will stop syntax highlight of the code to appear.
fields.summary: If a file has too many lines of codes, syntax highlight will not work and the codes are shown in plain text instead

fields.description:
I'm trying to create a link to the bitbucket file viewer, but the links are not pointing to the proper place when using the {{[link display text](url)}} markdown syntax. For example, both the following links should point to the same place, but the markdown one points to this page.

https://bitbucket.org/osrf/gazebo/src/8f2b990230cd32df220034bbb98aa6c9f47af8c2/gazebo/physics/World.cc?fileviewer=file-view-default#World.cc-2180:2198

[the same link points elsewhere|https://bitbucket.org/osrf/gazebo/src/8f2b990230cd32df220034bbb98aa6c9f47af8c2/gazebo/physics/World.cc%3Ffileviewer%3Dfile-view-default#World.cc-2180:2198]

paste of raw code of this issue:

{code}
https://bitbucket.org/osrf/gazebo/src/8f2b990230cd32df220034bbb98aa6c9f47af8c2/gazebo/physics/World.cc?fileviewer=file-view-default#World.cc-2180:2198

[the same link points elsewhere](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/gazebo/src/8f2b990230cd32df220034bbb98aa6c9f47af8c2/gazebo/physics/World.cc?fileviewer=file-view-default#World.cc-2180:2198)
{code}

EDIT: further debugging shows that it is the {{:}} character separating the line ranges {{2180:2198}} is the culprit. Removing the {{:}} allows the Markdown to parse correctly, though the link is broken.
fields.summary: Markdown links not resolved properly

fields.description:
I can't render preview on the issue tracker, get this message:

!2972582713-Capturar.PNG|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Can't render preview

fields.description:
I can't add any comments to the issue tracker. If I try to add a comment from the issue tracker nothing happens, but when I try to change the status I get this:

!2110655882-Capturar.PNG|thumbnail!

Then I can't add any more comments until I reload the page again and get the same error.
fields.summary: Can't interact with issue tracker comments

fields.description:
Our webhooks have failed to establish connections to our jenkins master over SSL.  The master is behind an ELB in AWS which is hosting a valid comodo cert.

Simply changing the webhook's endpoint from HTTPS to -> HTTP resolves the issue (see screenshot, bottom attempt is over HTTPS and the top two successful attempts are over HTTP).
fields.summary: Webhook fails to establish SSL connection with comodo cert

fields.description:
It's a nice feature to review comments of a reviewer of a pull request in Bitbucket.  But one thing is annoying:

Imagine a large class with many changes and a comment at the end of the class. When replying to the comment, one might already have forgotten the name of the class.  To get that name, it's necessary to scroll up to the top of the class.  And then back down to the comment.

It would be better to see the class name somewhere else. Maybe as mouce-over on the left side, where the line number are given
fields.summary: pull request, always show class name of comment that is currently being replied (BB-14906)

fields.description:
Currently if i have to assign an issue to me, then i need to edit the issue and then do this.\\
would it be possible to provide an option, "assign to me" on the right side along with "Resolve" option. Would reduce a huge pain.

This is a classic scenario for issue fixing, when developers would like to pro-actively take up issues from an open list.
fields.summary: Feature Request : Assign to me option on the issue detail page (BB-14907)

fields.description: When using the bitbucket API endpoint "https://bitbucket.org/api/2.0/repositories/{{team}}/{{repo}}/pullrequests/" the reviewers object is not returned. This issue started to happen around yesterday in the afternoon.
fields.summary: Reviews object not being returned from bitbucket api

fields.description: It'd be great to have buttons in the commit view to navigate to the previous commit and next commit in the log.
fields.summary: Prev & Next Buttons (BB-14908)

fields.description:
Recently I was reviewing a pull request from a team member in a private repo. I was adding a non-formatted code snippet (less than one line, so didn't want to use the code formatter) and referenced '@ synchronize' except with no space. After posting my comment, it added the user with that user name (https://bitbucket.org/Synchronize/) to the comment in what look like a comment tag.

My bug report (perhaps improvement) is that I shouldn't be able to tag a user and use the @ tag freely so long as that user can not see/should not be able to see the repo and the subsequent pull request page.
fields.summary: @ tag user

fields.description: While we are still supposed to show team members first in mentions (@ username), there are still areas where this doesn't work quite well (issues for example). This could be tightened up to prevent mentioning incorrect people getting mentioned.
fields.summary: Team member mentions in teams can be improved (BB-14874)

fields.description:
This is more of an information display issue. When a user authorizes the use of the application it shows under their user account, but the consumer will show under the team. It would be nice to show these both on the same OAuth page:

* Authorized Application for team by (user)
* Consumer for application
fields.summary: Display authorized application under team's 'OAuth' page as well as the user who authorized (BB-14866)

fields.description:
Hi,

My repository https://bitbucket.org/ilwt/android_device_samsung_manta seems to be stuck on "This repository is currently unavailable". Could you please delete it so I can restart it? Thank you very much.
fields.summary: Import stuck

Thanks

fields.description:
I recently dealt with a use-case for a fairly large product I work on which required me to use the API BitBucket provides to automate not only creation of a lot of private repositories but also duplication of a number of them. I found the API lacking in latter functionality. I discovered the /repo/import functionality on the Web which was exactly what I wanted but not on the API. After having explained my use-case and requirement on a support ticket, I was asked to create a request here. If this is something more people would use, I'd like to request the devs to consider it for a moment.

Thanks.
fields.summary: Add /repo/import functionality to the API (BB-15090)

fields.description: I had a list of issues that I wanted to filter to the ones assigned to me, so I clicked my name under the "assignee" column, and I got a 404 error.
fields.summary: Filtering issues by assignee gives a 404 error

fields.description:
Hey Bitbucket.

I am currently experiencing that the webhooks are not firing on push. My issue the is exactly descibed in BCLOUD-11926.
fields.summary: Webhooks not firing

fields.description:
In the two-step verification page under "Manage account": https://bitbucket.org/account/user/{username}/two-step-verification/

When step 1 (Set up SSH on your account) has not yet been completed:

bq. Once you've *enable* two-step verification on your account, (...)
fields.summary: Typo in the two-step verification page (BB-14808)

fields.description:
I have forked a repo from others, and I have the "Admin Access level".\\
I would like to delete it, but the "Delete Button" is not available to click.

The repo is zcchen/python-3-patterns-idioms

Thanks for reading it.
fields.summary: Could NOT Delete a Repo Forked from Others

fields.description:
We have an issue but I believe that it might be related to how we are making our changes. Basically we are seeing the non-conflicting merges in the remote git branch that the local git branches are making.

We are running the following commands

git clone remotebranch local

cd local

git checkout localBranch\\
//make change is localBranch

git pull remotebranch\\
// merge happens but not in a file local developer is working in

git commit -m " changes"

git push\\
// merge shows in remote branch
fields.summary: Local Merges showing in remote branch after push

fields.description:
All existing criteria is categorized as "reported by" instead of the actual parameter type.

*Works best if you start from a query saved as a url*\\
1 - Open your saved query, note the results\\
2 - Click the ADVANCED SEARCH link\\
3 - Notice that the first Advanced search field is defaulting to REPORTED BY\\
4 - Click SEARCH, notice the difference in results

Here is initial url... https://bitbucket.org/***/enterpriseweb/issues?milestone=Release+Update+10&status=new&status=open

Here are the initial results... note parameter categories at the top of milestone and status

!2824771744-initial%20results.png|thumbnail!

Click on advanced search, and this is what it looks like... all parameters assigned to "reported by".

!4117130066-advanced%20search.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Advanced search link mangles existing criteria (BB-14798)

fields.description: The pull request activity log should always show the diffs as there were when the comment was made. If other commits are made to the target branch or if the source branch is rebased/updated the diffs are (sometimes?) changed from what they were when a comment was made.
fields.summary: Pull request activity log is not robust - diffs may change from when comment was made (BB-15269)

fields.description:
If you go to a teams repos page, and they have more than one page of repos.  For example:\\
https://bitbucket.org/atlassian/

Click on page 2 at the bottom, you get improperly redirected back to your repos page.  For example:\\
https://bitbucket.org/gsackett/?page=2

In this case, I do not have a second page of repos, so i get an error on the page that states:\\
Oops!\\
Something has gone terribly wrong...
fields.summary: Team repository page improperly redirecting to user account repos page. (BB-14780)

fields.description:
See screenshot:\\
!588938340-transfer.png|thumbnail!

fields.description:
I was trying to compare my repository forked from an other user and it shows me one commit.\\
The commit link should be from the initial repository but when I click on it, the url is : https://bitbucket.org/chaasof/bitbucket-type-cloud/branches/compare/tpettersen/bitbucket-type-cloud:master%0Dchaasof/bitbucket-type-cloud:master (it's like the commit was from my repository and it's wrong )\\
it should be : https://bitbucket.org/tpettersen/bitbucket-type-cloud/branches/compare/tpettersen/bitbucket-type-cloud:master%0Dchaasof/bitbucket-type-cloud:master

while trying to pull or push commits it shows fatal: unable to access 'https://bitbucket.org/salyani/fulmala/': Could not resolve host: bitbucket.org through git shell and samrtgit too.\\

fields.description:
Regarding to [BCLOUD-11971|BCLOUD-11971], I noticed (maybe) pygments bug.

I've heard that BB is using pygments 1.5, if so, this is maybe pygments 1.5 bug. At least latest pygments (2.0.2) itself doesn't have this problem.

Please see [https://bitbucket.org/hhsprings/test4wiki/wiki/Home|https://bitbucket.org/hhsprings/test4wiki/wiki/Home].
fields.summary: Upgrade pygments to latest version. (BB-14799)

fields.description: If users try to transfer a repository to a newly-created team account, it will end up with a 500 error. However, users can transfer it to an older team account without any issue.
fields.summary: A newly-created team account won't appear in the Teams dropdown list, and users won't be able to transfer repository to a newly-created team. (BB-14767)

fields.description: Receive error "State parameter is missing or incorrect" when trying to connect an existing account.  Doesn't affect new integrations/accounts.
fields.summary: Unable to connect existing accounts to google oauth (BB-14741)

fields.description: Please delete https://bitbucket.org/cts-america/nuget it is returning repository unavailable
fields.summary: Repository unavailable

fields.description: When trying to see what other repositories, does the team HipChat has in BitBucket and whatever link is click of the pagination, it redirects to the users profile with the page number that is being clicked.
fields.summary: Can't see other pages of the repositories of a user / team in Bitbucket

fields.description:
It would be nice if issues would get reverted to the previous status when you would do a git reset head.

Example:\\
Add issue BCLOUD-1\\
resolve the bug and commit with a message "close BCLOUD-1"\\
push to origin

decide to reset the HEAD of the branch\\
git push --force origin master

Result\\
Issue is still closed and references a commit that does not exist anymore
fields.summary: Improvement Request: Issues to be reverted to the previous states when git reset is performed (BB-15091)

fields.description:
Usually for smaller or internal projects, voting is not something that's used at all. Yet, it's a field that occupies space in the issue details (no big deal here) and the issue list (big deal here - that's a table with a lot of columns already).

Would be great to be able to disable voting - just like we can disable components, milestones or versions if there's none to be used.
fields.summary: Add option to disable votes for the issue tracker (BB-14763)

fields.description:
Hello,

I'm trying to clone my project from a git repository. And it doesn't work. I'm waiting but it never finishes. When I just download the archive, it takes 5 minutes, so what's the problem here? Thanks
fields.summary: Cloning from a repository for more than 15 hours without completing for less than 1Go

fields.description:
Hi,\\
I recently developed a Bitbucket addon and for development purposes I hosted the addon from a Cloud9 server. The add-on worked perfectly. However, I recently moved the add-on to Heroku for production release and initially the add-on OAuth consumer failed to load the addon since Heroku does not provide SSL support straight out i.e. Heroku gives http sites and not https which doesn't play nice with Bitbucket's add on managers, it would seem.\\
I added a Heroku SSL add-on to serve my add-on via https and now when I try to load the add-on, it just times out on Bitbucket.

If I change the Add-On's URL back to the Cloud9 url and don't make any other changes, the add on works perfectly. Can you please provide info on why this is happening? Am I missing something on the Add-On dev docs?
fields.summary: Bitbucket Plugin not working from Heroku

fields.description:
Take any public facing account with public repos:

# Log out of Bitbucket
# Go to overview page
# None of the public repos will be seen until you enter in a search term (or character) under the page filter
fields.summary: Public repos on overview do not show unless you type in filter terms (BB-14733)

fields.description:
Hello,\\
after bitbucket went back from total unavailability, I keep getting such errors :

{code}
#!C

ssh_exchange_identification: Connection closed by remote host
fatal: Could not read from remote repository.
Please make sure you have the correct access rights
and the repository exists.
{code}

Our Jenkins jobs are blocked too because of such errors.

Could you please inform us when everything is back to normal ?

KInd regards,\\
Marc Laffitte
fields.summary: Bitbucket not working

fields.description:
When I try to remove a user from the team's plan (i.e. https://bitbucket.org/account/user/team-name/plans-and-billing/) I expect users to disappear from that list and from any groups they were member of.

However the following happens: the "Users on this team" counter is decremented but the user is still listed (won't go away even after a refresh, so seems not to be removed at all) and is still member of all groups.
fields.summary: Removing user from team plan doesn't work

fields.description:
Hi,

Every time I try to do any kind of operation on any of the repositories I have access it is now showing the following error:

ssh_exchange_identification: Connection closed by remote host\\
fatal: Could not read from remote repository.

Please make sure you have the correct access rights\\
and the repository exists.

Is that related to the current outage? It was working a few hours ago...

That is affecting to the whole team.
fields.summary: Connection closed

fields.description: The reviewers toggle to the commits section to review changes commit by commit. Comments made on commits are not associated with the pull request, which causes two problems. First, the comments do not show up in the Activity section of the pull request - requires QA system to have records for the code reviews and would be much more easier to use the pull request Activity section. The second problem, and this is worse, is that comments on commits are lost if the developer rebases the commits in the pull request.This problem could be fixed by providing an overview mode that is something like "git log --reverse -p target_branch..pull_request_branch", ie all the changes in one screen like the current overview but organised commit by commit.
fields.summary: Pull request support for reviewing commit-by-commit (BB-14731)

fields.description: The reviewers toggle to the commits section to review changes commit by commit. Comments made on commits are not associated with the pull request, which causes two problems. First, the comments do not show up in the Activity section of the pull request - requires QA system to have records for the code reviews and would be much more easier to use the pull request Activity section. The second problem, and this is worse, is that comments on commits are lost if the developer rebases the commits in the pull request.This problem could be fixed by providing an overview mode that is something like "git log --reverse -p target_branch..pull_request_branch", ie all the changes in one screen like the current overview but organised commit by commit.
fields.summary: Pull request support for reviewing commit-by-commit
API calls are failing with status code=403, This endpoint does not support token-based authentication (BB-14737)

fields.description: In some cases SSH cannot be used and HTTPS is needed. Implementation of user tokens like GitHub: https://github.com/blog/1509-personal-api-tokens would be really helpful.
fields.summary: Implement user tokens

fields.description:
When on the overview page for a team, (displaying a list of repos) the pagination links at the bottom point to the wrong URL. Following the link results in a 404. It's not a major issue, but it is extremely annoying to have to type the URL in manually or have to go via the dashboard to see all repos.

Expected result:\\
For the pagination link URL's to be of the form https://bitbucket.org/{team-name}/?page=X

Actual result:\\
The pagination link URL's are of the form https://bitbucket.org/{username}/?page=X
fields.summary: Wrong links on team overview pagination (using username instead) (BB-14727)

fields.description:
Hi - I was trying to delete my repository (https://bitbucket.org/PxlAlchmy/axii) but it ended up just showing an error message after a while, perhaps due to the ongoing issue with the faulty network device?

The repository is now shown in my list, but I'm not able to do anything with it - it just says "_This repository is currently unavailable._"

Any chance it could be deleted some other way?\\
Sorry if this isn't the right channel to raise this.
fields.summary: This repository is currently unavailable.

fields.description:
Hi.

I´m facing an Internal Server Error trying to reach\\
GET /api/1.0/repositories/tecsinapse/sin-plus/tags/ HTTP/1.1

Error:\\
{\\
"error":  {\\
"message": "Internal server error",\\
"id": "6161f688e3ad42039a84749bf7322d06"\\
}\\
}

Thanks in advance.
fields.summary: Internal Server Error while calling tags api endpoint

fields.description:
It is sometimes not possible for us to merge pull requests straight away (sometime we wait until we are certain which feature are going into the next release). As a result, some of our pull requests can last for some time, and as you'd expect, conflicts result.

It would be nice to be able to see an overview of which PRs have conflicts. Perhaps an icon on the main PR page?
fields.summary: Feature Request: Conflict status on PR page

fields.description:
Hi Guys,\\
I like that we can get a list of all pull requests for a repository, but I'd really like to get ALL pull requests belonging to my team, without having to request a list of all repositories, and then request pull requests for each one.

Basically, instead of using:\\
https://bitbucket.org/api/2.0/repositories/{owner}/{repo_slug}/pullrequests/\\
I'd like to use:\\
https://bitbucket.org/api/2.0/repositories/{owner}/pullrequests/

By removing the repo_slug, I should be able to see any and all pullrequests belonging to that owner.

This is essentially (I believe) the equivalent of doing the following in the web front end:

* Dashboard -> Pull Requests
* Click 'Teams'
* I see a list of all open Pull Requests belonging to anyone in the team.

If this was possible via a single API request, that would be fantastic!
fields.summary: API: Show Pull Requests for All Repositories

fields.description:
Hi,

We have seen 2 instances whereby members of our team have been able to commit to our private repo's with the author showing as their personal account. However, only their work account is permissioned for the repo.

Is this a known issue? Is there any way to prevent it?

Thanks\\
Phil
fields.summary: Personal account able to commit into private repo

fields.description:
I commit to Bitbucket and I see update commit page.\\
But Recent Activity is not update at least six hour.
fields.summary: Recent Acitvity is not update

fields.description:
h3. *This is currently being tracked at https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/BCLOUD-17417*
h3. Summary

Going to the Branches page in a Bitbucket repository, the Behind and Ahead columns do not show the respective number of commits. This was first reported after the Bitbucket website outage on Oct 21, 11:04 UTC.

This affects only some repositories, not all of them. We are still investigating the reason why this is affecting some repositories and not others.

Example of a repository that is affected:

[https://bitbucket.org/atlassian/confluence-jira-plugin/branches/]

Example of a repository that is not affected:

[https://bitbucket.org/atlassian/atlassian-rest/branches/]
h3. Expected Results

The Behind and Ahead columns should show the number of commits that a particular branch is behind and ahead of master branch.
h3. Actual Results

Behind and Ahead fields show a dash (-) instead. See attached screenshot.
fields.summary: The Behind/Ahead count in Branches page does not show any data for some repositories

fields.description:
It would be really useful to us to be able to add labels to pull requests, so that we can for example label which PRs should be accepted before a particular release (e.g. {{3.2.1}}).

They would also be useful for seeing at a glance the status of the PR (for example {{PassedQA}}).

-Finally they could be used to give a clue as to where a branch should be merged into (for example {{hotfix}} - some of our devs have been known to create PRs that are directed at the default branch, rather than selecting the correct hoxfix branch!)- (this has been resolved in the PR view)
fields.summary: Labels for pull requests
Hyperlink in issue comment reverses when sent by e-mail

fields.description:
h1. Steps to reproduce
# Open some changeset in two tabs.
# In one tab, approve it.
# Try to approve it also in another tab (without refreshing the page)

h1. Expected result
"You already approved this changeset." error message is shown and the page allows me to unapprove the changeset.

h1. Actual result
I see a JSON message:

{code}
#!javascript

{"error": {"message": "You already approved this changeset."}}
{code}

!4199880180-Screenshot%202015-10-20%2017.37.25.png|thumbnail!\\
Also, the "Approve" button is disabled and there is a spinner left spinning on it.
fields.summary: trying to approve already approved changeset results in JSON message shown as error (BB-14706)

fields.description:
Suppose I delete a comment from a pull request. This is the wording of the event in my "Recent activity" sidebar:

bq. *pull_request_title*

Pull request 1234 deleted from username/example-repo

Alex Chan (10 minutes ago)


I think that wording is very confusing. It sounds as if I've deleted the whole pull request, not just a single comment. This can be especially confusing if I clean up a lot of comments at once; suddenly I appear to be deleting the same PR repeatedly.

It would be helpful if this description was changed to be more accurate and less ambiguous. Something like:

bq. Comment deleted from pull request 1234 in username/example-repo
fields.summary: Improve the wording in "Recent Activity" of a deleted comment in a PR (BB-14761)

fields.description:
At least, I need 'console', and 'pycon' (both in pygments 1.5).

console: Bash Session / pycon: Python console session

See also [BCLOUD-11971], for supporting console session we need it, too.
fields.summary: Full support pygments lexers of Snippets?

fields.description: Though [BCLOUD-6103] was rejected, but we want MORE readable code snippet, especially console sessions (bash, python, ...). See: * [http://pygments.org/demo/1990467/?style=emacs] * [http://pygments.org/demo/1104592/?style=emacs] We don't need to customize CSS fully, but need at least emphasis .... Could you change style more readable (like emacs.css)?
fields.summary: Generic Prompts should be rendered as bold in syntax highlighted code (BB-14775)
Mercurial pull requests with bookmarks within the same repo show "There are no changes to be pulled" (BB-14693)

fields.description:
Hi,

I have two Git repos -- one I created directly and the other transferred from other account.

The one I directly created has been created with team ownership and I'm able to see the team name under owner in the access page.

To make it consistent, I also attempted to change the ownership of the transferred repo to the team name, but it says, I cannot grant access to team.

How come two Git repos in the same account have inconsistent ownership policies?
fields.summary: Inconsistent Git Repo ownership

fields.description:
This causes links to not render properly in commit comments or issues.

When creating a wiki link with {{[[1.0.0]]}}, no link was created, while {{[[100]]}} works just fine. It seems the wiki does not accept the {{.}} character for some unknown reason.

This is a little annoying since we usually create a wiki page for each version, but due to the bug mentioned above, pages like {{[[version 1.0.0]]}} cannot be created. It would be nice to see this bug fixed.
fields.summary: Wiki pages can be saved with brackets('[' ']') in the filename (BB-14827)

fields.description:
very frequently, we use our repository to get code review comments from people... or when we are trying to hire consultants and they ask to see the code to get an idea of the effort.

though I understand if someone can see the code, then the secret's out... but we want to make it hard for them to clone the repo and use it.

That is why it would be awesome to have "View only" permissions for a repository.. in which a user can browse the code, but the "raw" functionality as well as "clone" would be prevented.
fields.summary: "View" only permissions for repository (view without being able to clone) (BB-14756)

fields.description:
Having a large # of  TAGs or repo REFs in a git repo (3k or more (estimate)) causes slowdowns, and/or timeouts when taking actions in the UI.\\
For pull requests is causes a decline of a PR, loading a PR, loading change sets within a pr, etc.

Confirmed this with a git repo which has 11k tags.  Takes about 10-15 attempts to to decline any PR for this repo for a successful attempt.  All other attempts gave a sentry/500 error.
fields.summary: Large # of TAGs or REFs in a GIT repo causes slowdowns and/or timeouts in the UI. (BB-14688)

fields.description:
My organization has many different companies as members. Individuals' company email addresses are the backbone of our member management system. When companies terminate their membership, I need my staff to be able to easily identify the company's employees in Bitbucket Cloud so their repository access can be deactivated.

I chose Bitbucket over Github because I could specifically invite people using their company email addresses. However, now that they have access to the repository, all I can see is their Bitbucket user ID, which is rarely identifiable by company. I need a way in Bitbucket Cloud to view the active users by their email address.
fields.summary: Need to be able to view active repository members by email address (BB-14686)

fields.description:
The below link is unable to merge.

https://bitbucket.org/stutzen/tomatotail-io/pull-requests/10/master/diff
fields.summary: Unable To Merge

fields.description:
Sometimes a developer will accidentally change the permissions on a file, and check in the change. It would be good to spot these changes before they cause problems, ideally as part of code review when looking at a pull request.

The current web interface doesn't expose this information.

Here's an example commit diff. Which files have changed permissions?

!2217068611-fileperms2.png|thumbnail!

The answer is both of them, but it's hard to spot. The fact that the latter is in the diff with no apparent changes is a hint that the second file has different permissions; I can't see anything to indicate the change in the first file.

Even when I know the permissions have changed, I don't know what the old/new permissions are; this is also useful.

Please add something to the diff view that:

* Highlights when the file permissions have changed
* Tells me the old and new permissions
fields.summary: Show changes to file permissions in diffs and pull requests

fields.description:
I set up a workflow with a "primary" branch on which only a set of developers are allowed to push. Those who are not, create PR's with changes which are later review and merged/discarded accordingly.

Consider  a developer fixing issues {{#1}} and {{#2}} with a  PR {{#3}}. With the current "Issues" service, issues are marked as fixed as soon as the {{Fixes BCLOUD-1}} is part of the commit message. This means that issue {{#1}} will be marked as fixed even if the {{pr BCLOUD-3}} might not be merged.

As a workaround, the {{Fixes BCLOUD-1,#2}} can be part of the PR commit message (and not referenced in other commits), but then the history of the commit that fixed the issue is lost. I would want the issue to be marked as resolved only when the commit is part of the "primary" branch.

Workflow example:

# Two issues {{#1}} and {{#2}} are defined.
# Developer checkouts to a branch: {{bugfixes}}.
# Developer commits a fix to {{#1}}: {{git commit -m "Fix BCLOUD-1"}} (Issue is not yet marked as solved)
# Developer commits a fix for {{#2}}: {{git commit -m "Fix BCLOUD-2"}} (Issue is not yet marked as solved)
# Developer creates a PR for {{bugfixes}}.
# Contributor merges {{bugfixes}} into {{master}}
# Issue service marks {{#1}} and {{#2}} as fixed based on the commits merged into {{master}}

A solution for this would be to add an option to the _Issue_ service to restrict from which branches the issues can be marked as fixed. What are your thoughts on this?
fields.summary: Mark issues as fixed only when PR has been merged (BB-14687)

fields.description: The "Files changed" list in a Pull Request doesn't make it easy to see what files were added or removed. (Example attached.) It would nice to have icons or some visual representation on each file to indicate change status: Added, Updated, Deleted, or Moved (if possible).
fields.summary: Add icons to "Files changed" list in Pull Request (BB-14757)

fields.description: This would be either a repository-level or account-level setting to require that two-step verification be enabled for any user who tries to interact (push/pull/merge?) with the specified repository or repositories.
fields.summary: Setting to block access to a repository for users who don't have two-step verification enabled (BB-14662)

fields.description:
When somebody comment on your pull request you get a notification which is optionally also being forwarded as an e-mail. This is nice as you don't need to visit the PR to get to know the comments (and you can even reply via e-mail).

However if the comment is modified you won't get a new notification - and this can cause problems, like when somebody commenting "Good job!", but then editing to "Good job, but make sure to do x, y, z.". You probably won't visit the PR as you already got notified about the comment and it doesn't require any action from you, thus you won't see the edited version.

My suggestion would be to also send notifications on comment edits (and probably to send the first notification about 30s after the comment was made, so it can include any quick edits too).

This is true for pull request comments but probably also for commit diff line comments - the same issue.
fields.summary: Send a notification when a pull request comment is edited

fields.description:
When you create a repo in Bitbucket, you can select the "Language". A language that is becoming more common these days is YAML (yaml.org).  However, it is not in the list of selections. Please add it and support it.

Thanks,

Jason
fields.summary: Add YAML to supported languages list (BB-14661)
